result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan J Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*If probation revoked - huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow
Consecutive to: Consecutive to an other sentence currently being served

miscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surcharge
*If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
*Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

*Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
*Provide list of medications to agent 
*Sign releases for agent to be able to monitor medications being taken
*  Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:   Sarah Hansen and David Hansen including their residences or any place they are temporarily occupying with agent approval. 
*No abusive contact with Rebecca Lauer.  Agent can revoke the contact if it becomes harmful to Rebecca Lauer.
*Provide DNA sample if not already done so. 
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, unless already completed then comply with recommendations as stated and if agent approves of treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan J Anderson in court with attorney Sheila Janelle Kessler.  Defendant Jonathan J Anderson in custody.  Atty Louis Molepske appearing for Elizabeth R. Constable on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.

10:35 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
State has complied with victim notification; victim R.L. appears in court today.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 and Count 2 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Victim does not wish to make a statement to the Court.
Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Kessler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Warrant quashed.

Count 1 -
Impose/Stay 90 day jail sentence - consecutive to any other sentence currently being served
Jail credit of 18 days.
**If probation revoked - huber priveleges for work, counseling or any other reason the sheriff will allow.

Placed on Probation for a period of 12 months:
**Conditions of Probation:
*Pay costs - DNA Surcharge
*AODA & comply with treatment recommendations, unless already completed then comply with recommendations stated and if agent approves.
*Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Provide list of medications to agent.
*Sign releases for agent to be able to monitor medications being taken.
*Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Sarah Hansen and David Hansen including their residences or any place they are temporarily occupying with agent approval.
*No abusive contact with Rebecca Lauer.  Agent can revoke the contact if becomes harmful to Rebecca Lauer.
*Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
*Provide DNA sample if not already done so.
*Participate in any counseling or assessments as recommended by the agent.

Count 2 - DRI
Ad Prosequendum with attached Writ of Habeas Corpus Ad Prosequendum /s/ TBE 02/12/16
